issues.description: The problem statement and template require Farm to have a no‚Äêargument constructor ("Initialize the ArrayList in a constructor with no arguments"), but the solution only provides a constructor Farm(int initialCapacity) and omits a default constructor. As a result, client code using new Farm() (e.g., in Main) will fail to compile.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a public no-argument constructor to Farm (e.g., public Farm() { this.animals = new ArrayList<>(); }) so that new Farm() compiles and initializes the list as specified.
